intro: Nassauvia pumila var. nordenskjoldii, commonly known as the Arctic sand verbena, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It typically features prostrate or ascending stems covered in fine, silky hairs. The leaves are linear to lanceolate, often with a bluish-gray hue due to dense pubescence. It produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or purple, which bloom in late summer. This plant is adapted to harsh, cold environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
